Generally though, people miss the immediacy. The
dynamism of radio broadcasting. We have forgotten
the powerful impact upon people of program series
such as "You Are There." There are still many people,
however, who recall the evening Mr. Orson Welles
"shook up" the whole country with a coast to coast,
Mercury Theatre production about some mythical
"Martians." Practically every adult can recall the
excitement and wonder of "Buck Rogers In the Twenty
Fifth Century," a radio series about space exploration,
in the true "adventure" spirit. Others, though not
too many, will recall the brilliant "Columbia WorkÂ¬
shop," and the series of Shakespeare, Ibsen, the Greek
Tragedy cycle, stunning productions of Euripidean and
Sophoclean drama.
